entry.title: How to Create a Jekyll Zite

link.title: How to Create a Jekyll Zite

entry.content:
1. install ruby and add execution path to .bashrc: PATH="$(ruby -e 'print Gem.user_dir')/bin:$PATH". [ref] Then install Jekyll with $ gem install jekyll bundler

  2. Create a new site: $ jekyll new my-p2p-blog and a empty zite (From ZeroHello 3-dot menu)

  3. Edit /my-p2p-blog/_config Copy the new zite address to baseurl. Also edit other thing as you like. Newest json gem seems incompatible, so I add gem "json", "2.0.2" in /my-p2p-blog/Gemfile. [ref]

  4. Install gems $ bundle install, then update config with $ bundle exec jekyll build. Then copy files in /my-p2p-blog/_site to your new zite: $ cp /my-p2p-blog/_site/* /path/to/zeronet/data/ZITE_ADDRESS/.

  5. On your new zite, open the config panel (Drag to 0 button to left) and sign your content.json.

For the gallery example, check this, for other themes, check this
entry.summary: install ruby and add execution path to .bashrc: PATH="$(ruby -e 'print Gem.user_dir')/bin:$PATH". [ref] Then install Jekyll with $ gem install jekyll bundler

entry.title: A Dark Theme for ZeroNet
entry.content:
This theme should work on all official zites and their clones. Some unofficial zites are also supported, like NullPaste, ZeroWiki, Kaffiene Search. Nevertheless, some other zites may have side effects - that some bright elements are still not changed. You can ask me to modify them, try it yourself or temporarily disable the theme.

You need Stylish add-on/plugin to install it. Tip: If you use Firefox, in the Manage Styles Setting you can choose Install from URLs, then simply copy the link below and install it (for NullPaste bin it doesn’t work in this way).

Screenshots:

ZeroNet Dark Theme Gallery

Get it from:

this zite

my ZeroBlog

my NullPaste bin Repository on git.gnu.io

userstyle.org (Unmaintained, easy to install but the website contains many third-party javascripts)

Discussion Thread on ZeroTalk
entry.summary: This theme should work on all official zites and their clones. Some unofficial zites are also supported, like NullPaste, ZeroWiki, Kaffiene Search. Nevertheless, some other zites may have side effects - that some bright elements are still not changed. You can ask me to modify them, try it yourself or temporarily disable the theme.

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.
